review_title: A Top Employer who really cares
pros:
Throughout the pandemic staff could not have been given more support, flexibility and care. I have felt totally supported and been reminded countless times how much I am appreciated and valued.
Weekly comms and college wide staff meetings from the principal have been invaluable in keeping morale high and ensuring staff are kept up to date with how things were being managed.
A well led institution who do all they can to support and develop staff even under tough and challenging circumstances. (COVID)
cons: I used to think what a tough job as I had as a full time member of teaching staff.... but I now realise how every teacher feels the same pressures.... but not every teacher ( and I know many) is lucky enough to work in such a caring college where staff matter as much as the students.

review_title: One to avoid. Much better Colleges out there  to pursue a career with.
pros: Well located campus at Castleford. Good support for learners with additional needs.
cons: Huge turnover of staff in engineering, automotive and construction. This is down to inept management  with yes people employed to appease a nepotistic group of senior leaders. If you are thinking of getting into teaching, there are far better Colleges in the area.

pros: A reasonably good place to work for
cons: Cannot think of any, would not say

pros: Some great hard-working staff who cared about teaching. staff created an excellent culture for education and learning often putting in way too many hours of work.
cons: Very poor management with a business-focused agenda, not afraid to step on and over people to achieve their goals, of higher student numbers and retention rates for larger funding pot. There is also a massive pay gap between the staff at the bottom and those at the top. Facilities had terrible parking and staff development was very poor, resulting in staff paying for there own CPD activities to improve there teaching at times. Very low staff retention rates within English and maths, due to lack of support and guidance from senior management who was unable to implement any effective behavioural policy and instead often left teachers to fend for them selfs.

pros: Supportive environment for staff - departments within the college are like small families, where everybody pulls together to share ideas, information and generally support each other. Teaching is not always easy, however the team in which i work make it better with their continuous support and advice.
cons: The facilities at the college could do with some investment and development to further enhance both the staff and students overall experience. The classrooms for technical qualifications should be more interactive for all that use them which would provide learners with the opportunity to develop their practical skills.

pros: Clear vision but a caring and supportive culture where staff matter and are valued from the very top.
cons: FE generally is a tough gig - but people working in this sector know that, and are in it for the students.
